Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Shep I (9-20) (Shepherin I fragment, Synthetic AMPs, Gly-rich, His-rich, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 42.86% similar toShepherin IG: 67%, H: 33%.Activity: active against C.albicans MDM8 or ATCC 90028 or HU 168 (MIC >100 uM), C. parapsilosis ATCC 22019 (MIC 100 uM), C.krusei ATCC 6258 (MIC >100 uM), C. tropicalis Squibb 1600 (MIC 100 uM), and S.cerevisiae ATCC 2601 (MIC >100 uM).Provided by Maria TerÃªsa Machini 11/2024
Literature Information.Author: Remuzgo C, Oewel TS, Daffre S, Lopes TR, Dyszy FH, Schreier S, Machado-Santelli GM, Teresa Machini M.2014
Literature Information.Title: Chemical synthesis, structure-activity relationship, and properties of shepherin I: a fungicidal peptide enriched in glycine-glycine-histidine motifs.
